TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit BitmapEncoder extends System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherObject

Docs.summary: Encodes a collection of objects to an image stream.

remarks.format:
## Remarks A derived codec may also provide support for specialized encoding properties, which are used to determine how a bitmap is encoded. For example, a codec may support specialized compression routines or interlacing of an encoded image.
You can specify multiple frames for any derived encoder, even if the bitmap format only supports one frame. In this case, only the first frame is saved.
The collection of frames can be encoded one at a time to any number of file streams.
Encoding does not work in partial trust. See [WPF Partial Trust Security](~/docs/framework/wpf/wpf-partial-trust-security.md) for information on partial trust.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to use the derived <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.TiffBitmapEncoder> class to encode an image.
[!code-csharp[bitmapframeexample#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/BitmapFrameExample/CSharp/BitmapFrame.cs#3)] [!code-vb[bitmapframeexample#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/BitmapFrameExample/VB/BitmapFrame.vb#3)]

remarks.format:
## Remarks A <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCodecInfo> implementation is required for every codec.
## Examples The following example shows how to read information from a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCodecInfo> object and send it to a string.
[!code-csharp[bitmapframeexample#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/BitmapFrameExample/CSharp/BitmapFrame.cs#3)] [!code-vb[bitmapframeexample#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/BitmapFrameExample/VB/BitmapFrame.vb#3)]

Docs.exception: The encoder does not support color profiles.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapEncoder Create(valuetype System.Guid containerFormat) cil managed

Docs.param: Identifies the desired bitmap encoding format.
Docs.summary: Creates a from a that identifies the desired bitmap format.
Docs.returns: A that can encode to the specified .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is provided for extensibility purposes only. Codec authors must generate their own <xref:System.Guid> to identify their newly created encoder. Use the derived <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapEncoder> classes, such as the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BmpBitmapEncoder> class, to create an encoder for a built in codec.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the individual frames within an image.
Docs.value: A collection of objects within the image.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Only [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_tiff](~/includes/tlasharptla-tiff-md.md)], [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_gif](~/includes/tlasharptla-gif-md.md)], and [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_wdp](~/includes/tlasharptla-wdp-md.md)] images support more than one frame. Attempts to add additional frames to formats that do not support them will result in only the first frame being encoded. ## XAML Text Usage You cannot use this property in [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xaml](~/includes/tlasharptla-xaml-md.md)]. ## Examples The following example shows how to add a frame to an encoder. [!code-csharp[bitmapframeexample#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/BitmapFrameExample/CSharp/BitmapFrame.cs#3)] [!code-vb[bitmapframeexample#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/BitmapFrameExample/VB/BitmapFrame.vb#3)]

Docs.exception: The value that is passed to the encoder is .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the metadata that will be associated with this bitmap during encoding.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Bitmap images support and store metadata differently. For more information about the metadata types that are supported for each bitmap, see the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapMetadata> class.

Docs.exception: The encoder does not support global metadata.
An attempt is made to write metadata in an incompatible format.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that represents the of an encoded bitmap.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Only [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_tiff](~/includes/tlasharptla-tiff-md.md)] and [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_gif](~/includes/tlasharptla-gif-md.md)] images (and some older, non-standard [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_bmp](~/includes/tlasharptla-bmp-md.md)] images) support palettes.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to apply a custom palette to a [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_tiff](~/includes/tlasharptla-tiff-md.md)] image and subsequently encode it.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Save(class System.IO.Stream stream) cil managed

Docs.param: Identifies the file stream that this bitmap is encoded to.
Docs.summary: Encodes a bitmap image to a specified .

remarks.format:
## Remarks In the context of this [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_api](~/includes/tlasharptla-api-md.md)], "save" and "encode" are synonymous.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to save a bitmap image to a file stream by using the derived <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.TiffBitmapEncoder> class.
[!code-csharp[bitmapframeexample#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/BitmapFrameExample/CSharp/BitmapFrame.cs#3)] [!code-vb[bitmapframeexample#3](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/BitmapFrameExample/VB/BitmapFrame.vb#3)]

Docs.exception: The bitmap has already been encoded.
The count is less than or equal to zero.
